speaker: PAROLLES
text: Good Monsieur

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Lavatch, give my lord Lafew this letter. I have ere

speaker: PAROLLES
text: now, sir, been better known to you, when I have

speaker: PAROLLES
text: held familiarity with fresher clothes. But I am

speaker: PAROLLES
text: now, sir, muddied in Fortune’s mood, and smell

speaker: PAROLLES
text: somewhat strong of her strong displeasure.

speaker: FOOL
text: Truly, Fortune’s displeasure is but sluttish if it

speaker: FOOL
text: smell so strongly as thou speak’st of. I will henceforth

speaker: FOOL
text: eat no fish of Fortune’s butt’ring. Prithee,

speaker: FOOL
text: allow the wind.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Nay, you need not to stop your nose, sir. I

speaker: PAROLLES
text: spake but by a metaphor.

speaker: FOOL
text: Indeed, sir, if your metaphor stink I will stop my

speaker: FOOL
text: nose, or against any man’s metaphor. Prithee, get

speaker: FOOL
text: thee further.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Pray you, sir, deliver me this paper.

speaker: FOOL
text: Foh! Prithee, stand away. A paper from Fortune’s

speaker: FOOL
text: close-stool, to give to a nobleman!

speaker: FOOL
text: Look, here he comes himself.—Here is a purr of

speaker: FOOL
text: Fortune’s, sir, or of Fortune’s cat—but not a

speaker: FOOL
text: musk-cat—that has fall’n into the unclean fishpond

speaker: FOOL
text: of her displeasure and, as he says, is muddied

speaker: FOOL
text: withal. Pray you, sir, use the carp as you may,

speaker: FOOL
text: for he looks like a poor, decayed, ingenious, foolish,

speaker: FOOL
text: rascally knave. I do pity his distress in my

speaker: FOOL
text: smiles of comfort, and leave him to your Lordship.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: My lord, I am a man whom Fortune hath

speaker: PAROLLES
text: cruelly scratched.

speaker: LAFEW
text: And what would you have me to do? ’Tis too

speaker: LAFEW
text: late to pare her nails now. Wherein have you

speaker: LAFEW
text: played the knave with Fortune that she should

speaker: LAFEW
text: scratch you, who of herself is a good lady and

speaker: LAFEW
text: would not have knaves thrive long under her?

speaker: LAFEW
text: There’s a cardecu for you. Let the justices make

speaker: LAFEW
text: you and Fortune friends. I am for other business.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: I beseech your Honor to hear me one single

speaker: PAROLLES
text: word.

speaker: LAFEW
text: You beg a single penny more. Come, you shall

speaker: LAFEW
text: ha ’t. Save your word.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: My name, my good lord, is Parolles.

speaker: LAFEW
text: You beg more than a word, then. Cock’s my

speaker: LAFEW
text: passion; give me your hand. How does your drum?

speaker: PAROLLES
text: O my good lord, you were the first that

speaker: PAROLLES
text: found me.

speaker: LAFEW
text: Was I, in sooth? And I was the first that lost

speaker: LAFEW
text: thee.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: It lies in you, my lord, to bring me in some

speaker: PAROLLES
text: grace, for you did bring me out.

speaker: LAFEW
text: Out upon thee, knave! Dost thou put upon me

speaker: LAFEW
text: at once both the office of God and the devil? One

speaker: LAFEW
text: brings thee in grace, and the other brings thee out.

speaker: LAFEW
text:
Trumpets
                 
                sound
                .
               The King’s coming. I know by

speaker: LAFEW
text: his trumpets. Sirrah, inquire further after me. I

speaker: LAFEW
text: had talk of you last night. Though you are a fool

speaker: LAFEW
text: and a knave, you shall eat. Go to, follow.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: I praise God for you.
